posts.name: Ben
posts.cooked:
I am currently working on aligning a bot to the reef using April Tags and the Limelight 3. However, I’ve encountered issues retrieving tx , ty , and other values.

Target Detection: The light on the Limelight ( LL ) is blinking, indicating that a target has been found. Confirmed target detection by using the REST API on port 5807 . TX, TY, and TA all are updating on Shuffleboard when added via GUI.

Target Detection:

The light on the Limelight ( LL ) is blinking, indicating that a target has been found.

Confirmed target detection by using the REST API on port 5807 .

TX, TY, and TA all are updating on Shuffleboard when added via GUI.

Network Configuration: Everything on the bot is configured with static IPs as described here and here . I can access the Limelight’s configuration panel at 10.51.81.11:5801 and camera stream at port 5800 .

Network Configuration:

Everything on the bot is configured with static IPs as described here and here .

I can access the Limelight’s configuration panel at 10.51.81.11:5801 and camera stream at port 5800 .

Programming: I attempted to retrieve the tx and ty values using the following approaches: Limelight Helpers.java : Used the Network tables wrapper provided by Limelight. NetworkTables Code: NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("limelight").getEntry("tx").getDouble(0.0); Gave 0.0 even when values reported by REST API and Shuffleboard Subscriber Method: Tried using a subscriber method to access the data.

Programming:

I attempted to retrieve the tx and ty values using the following approaches: Limelight Helpers.java : Used the Network tables wrapper provided by Limelight. NetworkTables Code: NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("limelight").getEntry("tx").getDouble(0.0); Gave 0.0 even when values reported by REST API and Shuffleboard Subscriber Method: Tried using a subscriber method to access the data.

Limelight Helpers.java : Used the Network tables wrapper provided by Limelight.

Used the Network tables wrapper provided by Limelight.

NetworkTables Code: NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("limelight").getEntry("tx").getDouble(0.0); Gave 0.0 even when values reported by REST API and Shuffleboard

Gave 0.0 even when values reported by REST API and Shuffleboard

Subscriber Method: Tried using a subscriber method to access the data.

Tried using a subscriber method to access the data.

Limelight Naming: The Limelight is correctly named as limelight .

Limelight Naming:

The Limelight is correctly named as limelight .

When attempting to retrieve tx and ty values: The values returned are either 0.0 or a default value. This happens despite confirming that a target is detected (both via the blinking light and the REST API . The timestamp of the Network Table value doesn’t change, as verified by getAtomic()

The values returned are either 0.0 or a default value.

This happens despite confirming that a target is detected (both via the blinking light and the REST API .

The timestamp of the Network Table value doesn’t change, as verified by getAtomic()

Confirmed target detection visually (blinking LED) and via the REST API.

Verified network configuration and static IP setup.

Team number is set on radio(New Radio), roboRIO, and LL .

Limelight 3, Radio, and roboRIO are all flashed/imaged with the latest firmware.

Tried multiple retrieval methods, including: Limelight Helpers.java NetworkTables Subscriber method Entry Method

Limelight Helpers.java

NetworkTables Subscriber method Entry Method

Subscriber method

Entry Method

Vision Subsystem

Thanks for any help.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
The javadocs for subscribe say

The subscriber is only active as long as the returned object is not closed.

However, your subscriber is a local variable in RobotContainer

posts.name: Ben
posts.cooked: I just changed it a few hours ago after something similar to your suggestion didn’t work. This new change now appears to work.
